pageContext.claim: Since China joined, that's another beauty, the World Trade Organization in 2001, the United States has lost many more than 60,000 factories.
pageContext.analysis: Trump hypes the possible connection between these trade deals and the loss of jobs and factories. The Congressional Research Service concluded in 2015 that NAFTA likely had little impact on jobs. Manufacturing jobs in the United States have been adversely affected by many factors, especially changing consumer tastes and technology. Similarly, drawing a connection between Chinaâ€™s entry in the WTO and factory loses is a stretch, especially because the Great Recession play a big role in factory closings.
